Question: Why did the BLEU score drop when moving from the part-of-speech model to the linguistically adequate morphological generation model?

The BLEU score dropped by 5 points when moving to the morphological generation model because unnecessary independence assumptions were introduced by decomposing words into lemmas and tags, causing information loss and reducing translation quality.
Why did the BLEU score drop by 5 points when transitioning to the linguistically adequate morphological generation model?
